div1.p: Tisdel informs Hench that House Report No. 841, 71st Congress is not available.

div1.head: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941
div1.p:
APT-KEM
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE
DIVISION OF PUBLIC DOCUMENTS
WASHINGTON, D. C.
March 24, 1941. Dr. P. S. Hench,
Villa Atlantique Hotel,
Palm Beach, Florida.

It was necessary to refer your letter of March 21 to your Secretary,
Miss Fern Peterson, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, Minnesota, as there were no
copies available in this office of House Report No. 841, 71st Congress,
2nd Session.

ALTON P. TISDEL,
Superintendent of Documents.

p.hi: Handwritten letter to Drs Alvare & Recio (Emena differences)

div1.p:
I had the pleasure of meeting you and corresponding with you
last year about the site of Camp Lazear. I will arrive in
Havana (Hotel Nacional) this Friday to present to Dr Domingo
Ramos a report of my investigations regarding the true site
of Camp Lazear. I regret to inform you that those who
located the place for you were misinformed of to its
true location. We have found it on the San Jose Farm
of the Rojas family. But you will be most interested to know
that the place pointed out to you was the place where
Dr Lazear did & where those volunteers who later
developed experimental y F at Camp Lazear were brought
from Camp Lazear to be taken care of near Camp
Col. Port Hosp. Therefore you & Dr Recio were
directly responsible for the preservation of a historic
spot, one which remained of all means to preserved.

I hope to discuss to you & to Dr Ramos plans
whereby both sites may be properly memorialized. You
should have the sincere thanks of historically
minded & officialy for your part in
preserving the site where Lazear gave up his life
& others suffered to prove the truth of the wonderful
concept of Dr Finlay.
